SEARCH
Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
public interface IGameBoard
IGameBoard is an interface which contains the methods and functions implemented by GameBoard, GameBoardMem, and AbsGameBoard.

  • Method Summary

      Returns:
      number to win

    • checkIfFree

      default boolean checkIfFree(int c)
      Returns true if the column can accept another token; false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      c - column to be checked
      Returns:
      if the column is free return true, otherwise return false

    • dropToken

      void dropToken(char p, int c)
      Places token for player p in top open position.
      Parameters:
      p - player which is placing the token
      c - the column in which the token is to be placed

    • checkForWin

      default boolean checkForWin(int c)
      This function will check to see if the last token placed in column c resulted in the player winning the game. If so it will return true, otherwise false. Note: this is not checking the entire board for a win, it is just checking if the last token placed results in a win.
      Parameters:
      c - the column where the last token was placed
      Returns:
      return true if the placed token completes the maximum number of consecutive pieces needed for a win (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally); : false.

    • checkTie

      default boolean checkTie()
      This function will check to see if the game has resulted in a tie. A game is tied if there are no free board positions remaining. You do not need to check for any potential wins because we can assume that the checkForWin() is checking for win conditions as the game is played. It will return true if the game is tied and false otherwise.
      Returns:
      return true if the game has been tied (no free board positions AND no player has won), otherwise return false

    • checkHorizWin

      default boolean checkHorizWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in NumToWin in a row horizontally. Returns true if it does, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the last token placed
      p - player that placed the token
      Returns:
      return true if a win occured horizontally by that player, otherwise return false

    • checkVertWin

      default boolean checkVertWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in NumToWin in a row vertically. Returns true if it does, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the last token placed
      p - player that placed the token
      Returns:
      return true if a win occurred vertically by that player, otherwise return false

    • checkDiagWin

      default boolean checkDiagWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      checks to see if the last token placed (which was placed in position pos by player p) resulted in NumToWin in a row diagonally. Returns true if it does, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the last token placed
      p - player that placed the token
      Returns:
      return true if a win occured diagonally by that player, otherwise return false

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Returns what is in the given position in BOARD.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of gameboard to check
      Returns:
      the player whose piece is in that spot or ' ' if the position is empty

    • isPlayerAtPos

      default boolean isPlayerAtPos(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Returns true if the player is at pos; otherwise, it returns false.
      Parameters:
      pos - position to check
      player - player to check on behalf of
      Returns:
      return true if that player is in that position, otherwise return false
